title: ICML_1995_38_abs

sentences.text: An important area of learning in autonomous agents is the ability to learn domain-speciic models of actions to be used by planning systems .
In this paper , we present methods by which an agent learns action models from its own experience and from its observation of a domain expert .

These methods diier from previous work in the area in two ways : the use of an action model formalism which is better suited to the needs of a re-active agent , and successful implementation of noise-handling mechanisms .
Training instances are generated from experience and observation , and a variant of GOLEM is used to learn action models from these instances .
The integrated learning system has been experimentally validated in simulated construction and ooce domains .

Entity-previous_work_in_the_area.label: previous work in the area
Entity-previous_work_in_the_area.description: Research studies on learning domain-specific models of actions for autonomous agents, which are being distinguished from this paper's approach by its use of an action model formalism and noise-handling mechanisms.

Entity-an_agent_learns_action_model_from.label: an agent learns action models from its own experience and from its observation of a domain expert
aliases: an agent learns action models from its own experience and from its observation of a domain expert
Entity-an_agent_learns_action_model_from.description: A method or approach that enables an autonomous agent to learn and develop action models based on both its personal experiences and observations made while interacting with a domain expert.

mentions.local_name: an agent learns action models from its own experience and from its observation of a domain expert

Entity-method_by_which_an_agent_learns_a.label: methods by which an agent learns action models from its own experience and from its observation of a domain expert
aliases: methods by which an agent learns action models from its own experience and from its observation of a domain expert
Entity-method_by_which_an_agent_learns_a.description: The integrated learning system that combines the agent's self-experience with observations of a domain expert to learn action models.

mentions.local_name: methods by which an agent learns action models from its own experience and from its observation of a domain expert

Entity-in_this_paper.label: In this paper
Entity-in_this_paper.description: This paper presents methods for learning action models by autonomous agents from their own experience and observations of domain experts.

Entity-variant_of_golem.label: variant of GOLEM
Entity-variant_of_golem.description: A learning algorithm that learns action models from training instances generated from an agent's experience and observation.

Entity-the_integrated_learning_system.label: The integrated learning system
Entity-the_integrated_learning_system.description: A framework that combines methods for an agent to learn domain-specific models of actions from its own experience and observation, used to validate action model learning in simulated environments.

Entity-an_important_area.label: An important area
Entity-an_important_area.description: The learning ability in autonomous agents to develop domain-specific models of actions for use in planning systems.

Entity-we_present_method.label: we present methods
Entity-we_present_method.description: Methods for learning domain-specific models of actions used by planning systems in autonomous agents.

Entity-to_be_used_by_planning_system.label: to be used by planning systems
aliases: to be used by planning systems
Entity-to_be_used_by_planning_system.description: Domain-specific models of actions learned and utilized in autonomous agents' decision-making processes for planning purposes.

mentions.local_name: to be used by planning systems

Entity-a_re-active_agent.label: a re-active agent
Entity-a_re-active_agent.description: A type of autonomous agent that learns domain-specific models of actions from its own experience and observation, better suited for reactive planning systems.

Entity-experience_and_observation.label: experience and observation
Entity-experience_and_observation.description: The process by which an agent generates training data for learning domain-specific action models through its own experiences and observations.

Entity-these_method.label: These methods
Entity-these_method.description: Methods by which an agent learns action models from its own experience and observation, differing from previous work in the area.

Entity-simulated_construction_and_ooce_d.label: simulated construction and ooce domains
Entity-simulated_construction_and_ooce_d.description: Simulated environments for testing autonomous agents' action models, including construction and oceanic scenarios.

Entity-golem.label: GOLEM
Entity-golem.description: A type of algorithm or system that uses machine learning techniques to analyze and make decisions based on experience and observation.

Entity-the_use_of_an_action_model_formal.label: the use of an action model formalism
aliases: the use of an action model formalism
Entity-the_use_of_an_action_model_formal.description: The approach or method of using a specific formal system for representing and modeling actions, which is better suited to the needs of reactive agents.

mentions.local_name: the use of an action model formalism

Entity-autonomous_agent.description: Self-operating entities capable of making decisions and taking actions without direct human intervention.

Entity-planning_system.description: A type of software or technology that enables decision-making and strategic action selection based on available information, goals, and constraints.

Entity-method.description: A systematic approach or technique used for achieving a specific goal or solving a problem.

Entity-previous_work.label: previous work
Entity-previous_work.description: Research or studies conducted prior to the current investigation

summary: An important area of learning in autonomous agents is the ability to learn domain-speciic models of actions to be used by planning systems . In this paper , we present methods by which an agent learns action models from its own experience and from its observation of a domain expert . These methods diier from previous work in the area in two ways : the use of an action model formalism which is better suited to the needs of a re-active agent , and successful implementation of noise-handling mechanisms . Training instances are generated from experience and observation , and a variant of GOLEM is used to learn action models from these instances . The integrated learning system has been experimentally validated in simulated construction and ooce domains .

Predicate-use.label: use
Predicate-use.description: To 'use' something means to employ or utilize it for a specific purpose or function. The predicate 'use' indicates that the subject (the agent) exploits, manipulates, or leverages the object (planning systems) in some way to achieve its goals or accomplish a task.

Predicate-learns.label: learns
Predicate-learns.description: The predicate 'learns' indicates the acquisition of knowledge or understanding by the subject through interaction with the object. The connection between the subject and object suggests a process of cognitive development, where the subject gains insight into the nature of the object.

Predicate-learns_action_models_from_its_.label: learns action models from its own experience and observation
Predicate-learns_action_models_from_its_.description: The predicate 'learns action models from its own experience and observation' describes a process where an individual or entity develops understanding of actions by reflecting on their personal experiences, observations, and interactions. This connection between subject (agent) and object (domain expert) highlights the agent's ability to learn through self-reflection, experimentation, and exploration.

Predicate-differ_from.label: differ from
Predicate-differ_from.description: The predicate 'differ from' indicates a relationship of distinction or contrast between two entities (subject and object), suggesting that they have distinct characteristics, approaches, or outcomes. It implies a sense of separation or non-identity between the subject and the object.

Predicate-is_better_suited_to.label: is better suited to
Predicate-is_better_suited_to.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has inherent characteristics or properties that make it more effective or efficient for achieving its purpose when paired with the object. In other words, the subject and object form a harmonious combination where the subject's features are well-matched to accomplish something successfully.

Predicate-are_generated_from.label: are generated from
Predicate-are_generated_from.description: The predicate 'are generated from' indicates a causal relationship between the subject (the entity or entities that produce something) and the object (the source or origin of what was produced). It suggests that the subject's existence, actions, or experiences have led to the creation or emergence of the object. In general, this predicate implies a process of transformation, derivation, or development from one thing to another.

Predicate-is_used_to_learn.label: is used to learn
Predicate-is_used_to_learn.description: The predicate 'is used to learn' indicates a relationship between an entity (subject) and its purpose or function for acquiring knowledge. It suggests that the subject is designed, intended, or employed to facilitate learning processes.

Predicate-has_been_experimentally_valida.label: has been experimentally validated in
Predicate-has_been_experimentally_valida.description: This predicate indicates that a subject's effectiveness or accuracy was tested through experimentation within a specific context or domain, resulting in validation of its performance.

Predicate-is_an_important_area_of_learni.label: is an important area of learning
Predicate-is_an_important_area_of_learni.description: This predicate indicates that the subject represents a domain or field where knowledge and understanding are crucial for personal growth, professional development, or societal progress. The object refers to a specific aspect of this area of learning, highlighting its significance within the broader context.

Predicate-distinguishes_itself_from.label: distinguishes itself from
Predicate-distinguishes_itself_from.description: The predicate 'distinguishes itself from' indicates that the subject has unique characteristics or features that differentiate it from another entity, conceptually represented by the object. This relationship highlights the distinctiveness of the subject's approach, perspective, or methodology in comparison to others.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general category or concept represented by the object. The relationship between the subject and object is one of instantiation, where the subject exemplifies or embodies the characteristics of the broader term.
